extends CircuitBreaker

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.fishwife.jrugged.CircuitBreaker

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AsyncCircuitBreaker()
      Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      AsyncCircuitBreaker(FailureInterpreter fi)
      Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      AsyncCircuitBreaker(String name)
      Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      AsyncCircuitBreaker(String name, CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception> mapper)
      Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and using the supplied CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.
      AsyncCircuitBreaker(String name, FailureInterpreter fi)
      Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      AsyncCircuitBreaker(String name, FailureInterpreter fi, CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception> mapper)
      Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with the provided FailureInterpreter and using the provided CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.

      • AsyncCircuitBreaker

        public AsyncCircuitBreaker()
        Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).

      • AsyncCircuitBreaker

        public AsyncCircuitBreaker(String name)
        Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
        Parameters:
        name - the name for the AsyncCircuitBreaker.

      • AsyncCircuitBreaker

        public AsyncCircuitBreaker(FailureInterpreter fi)
        Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
        Parameters:
        fi - the FailureInterpreter to use when determining whether a specific failure ought to cause the breaker to trip

      • AsyncCircuitBreaker

        public AsyncCircuitBreaker(String name,
                           FailureInterpreter fi)
        Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
        Parameters:
        name - the name for the AsyncCircuitBreaker.
        fi - the FailureInterpreter to use when determining whether a specific failure ought to cause the breaker to trip

      • AsyncCircuitBreaker

        public AsyncCircuitBreaker(String name,
                           CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception> mapper)
        Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and using the supplied CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.
        Parameters:
        name - the name for the AsyncCircuitBreaker.
        mapper - helper used to translate a CircuitBreakerException into an application-specific one

      • AsyncCircuitBreaker

        public AsyncCircuitBreaker(String name,
                           FailureInterpreter fi,
                           CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception> mapper)
        Creates a AsyncCircuitBreaker with the provided FailureInterpreter and using the provided CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.
        Parameters:
        name - the name for the AsyncCircuitBreaker.
        fi - the FailureInterpreter to use when determining whether a specific failure ought to cause the breaker to trip
        mapper - helper used to translate a CircuitBreakerException into an application-specific one

    • Method Detail

      • invokeAsync

        public <T> org.springframework.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<T> invokeAsync(Callable<org.springframework.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<T>> callable)
                                                                        throws Exception
        Wrap the given service call with the AsyncCircuitBreaker protection logic.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The result of a future call
        Parameters:
        callable - the Callable to attempt
        Returns:
        ListenableFuture of whatever callable would return
        Throws:
        CircuitBreakerException - if the breaker was OPEN or HALF_CLOSED and this attempt wasn't the reset attempt
        Exception - if the CircuitBreaker is in OPEN state
